chats.text:
Hi there I try to install tooljet on my Linux-Server via docker-compose. When starting the docker container i get following message:
```WARNING: The DATABASE_BACKUP variable is not set. Defaulting to a blank string.
ERROR: Invalid interpolation format for "command" option in service "database-backup-service": "sh -c 'if [ "$DATABASE_BACKUP" = "true" ]; then
  until PGPASSWORD=$PG_PASS pg_isready -h $PG_HOST -p 5432; do
    echo "Waiting for PostgreSQL to become available..." && sleep 1;
  done;
  PGPASSWORD=$PG_PASS pg_dump --host=$PG_HOST --port=5432 --username=$PG_USER --dbname=$PG_DB -f "/backup/dump_$(date +'%Y%m%d%H%M%S').sql" &&
  find /backup -type f -mtime +30 -delete &&
  echo "Dump taken successfully." &&
  exit 0;
else
  echo "Skipping backup." &&
  exit 1;
fi'
"```
Has anyone some tips or a workaround for me?

elements.text: Hi, I have a use-case I want to solve using ToolJet. I want to display real-time streaming data on ToolJet from a Websocket or an MQTT endpoint. Can someone guide me on how to do this if it's possible..?

chats.text:
Hey <@4J17395>!
Yes, it's possible through CustomJS. You can use RunJS to query the data and display the information using the required components.
In case you need any external library like Socket, you can import it inside ToolJet and start using it.

Let me know if you have further doubts :smile:

Ref: <https://docs.tooljet.com/docs/data-sources/run-js/>

chats.text:

chats.text:
OK, I have experimented some more.  When I work with a brand new app, I can get things to show in both places on a container.  However, in my legacy app running on Tooljet cloud, I cannot get a few of the components to show up within the container on the mobile desktop. Some of them do, some of them don't.  I have moved them all around the container, trying to get them to appear in the mobile container and they don't.

So, I am guessing it may be a funky state my current app is in, rather than a general bug.  I have a workaround, so I guess I will call this one as resolved.  Sorry for a false alarm.

data.subject: Feature Requests Discussion for App Update
data.summary: <@4Le9d> suggested several features for app updates. <@4Lc35> and <@4J16656> appreciated the inputs. <@4K1ea3> was asked to forward the suggestions to respective teams.

elements.text: suggested several features for app updates.
was asked to forward the suggestions to respective teams.

chats.text:
Taking a breather from a bunch of updating of apps.  A few feature requests from things that come for me over and over.  And, don't hesitate to tell me they are already there, and I missed them:

1. As a programmer/designer, I would like to be able to select multiple components and drag or bump them to another place as a selected group, then quickly "ungroup" them.  Like most gui design tools. I am guessing this is a commonly requested feature.
2. As a programmer/designer, I would like to be able to have a complete view (including copying queries and viewing actions) of previously released versions.  I understand that once they are released you would need to make a new version from them in order to program.  I just frequently want to take something I did from another app and use it.  Currently, I would have to create a new version in development in order to fully view the code and copy it.  Then delete the new version when I am done. Seems necessarily cumbersome. 
3. As a programmer/designer, I would like to be able to set the fineness of the "grid" that the components snap to.  Sometimes it is too coarse.  
4. As a programmer/designer, I would like to be able to "micro bump" a component in between snap-to grid lines.  Maybe by holding down Alt or Ctrl or something while using the arrow keys or dragging.
5. As a programmer/designer, I would like to be able to turn on the grid to visualize it at any point, to assess by measurement (and not by eye),  how to clean up the UI and align things.
6. As a programmer/designer, while we are on align and groups - I would like to have align top, bottom center for selected groups of components.

As a programmer/designer, I would like to be able to have a complete view (including copying queries and viewing actions) of previously released versions.  I understand that once they are released you would need to make a new version from them in order to program.  I just frequently want to take something I did from another app and use it.  Currently, I would have to create a new version in development in order to fully view the code and copy it.  Then delete the new version when I am done. Seems necessarily cumbersome.
As a programmer/designer, I would like to be able to set the fineness of the "grid" that the components snap to.  Sometimes it is too coarse.

As a programmer/designer, I would like to be able to turn on the grid to visualize it at any point, to assess by measurement (and not by eye),  how to clean up the UI and align things.

data.subject: Discussing Issues and Solution for User Workspace Management in ToolJet
data.summary: <@4Le9d> raised concerns about how user workspaces operate in ToolJet. <@4Lcf1> suggested some solutions and informed about new feature development plan.

elements.text: raised concerns about how user workspaces operate in ToolJet.
suggested some solutions and informed about new feature development plan.

chats.text:
Hi, I have a couple of requests:

1. As an Admin, I want to be able to invite a brand new user to a workspace and have them ONLY have one workplace - the one I invited them to.  I just tested this. Users get 2 workplaces, which can cause confusion. They get "something went wrong" messages if they are signed on to the wrong workplace.  For MOST non-developer users, they will only use ToolJet for accessing the workplace to which they are invited.  This has caused ongoing confusion for my new users.
2. As a User, I want to be able to delete workplaces.  This is related to #1.

 2.  The Archive workspace feature is in roadmap.

data.subject: Resolving Table Data Refresh Without Showing Loading State
data.summary: <@4J165fb> needed to update table data without showing a loading state. <@4Kf63e> suggested using 'Loading state' but concluded by providing a detailed workaround involving use of queries and variables. <@4J165fb> confirmed the solution worked.

elements.text: needed to update table data without showing a loading state.
suggested using 'Loading state' but concluded by providing a detailed workaround involving use of queries and variables.

chats.text: But if I want to update only one column of a loaded table why i need to show the loading state?

elements.text: But if I want to update only one column of a loaded table why i need to show the loading state?

chats.text: Yes.

Hi Gustavo,

I've confirmed with the team. You can achieve this by filling the Table component with data using a variable. You can update this variable when the data update query runs successfully.

Let's say we have two queries - getData and updateData.

1. Add a `Query Success` event to the getData query and  select the setVariable action to save the returned data in a variable (you will have to define the key and value for this, value will be the returned data i.e. queries.getData.data).
2. Load the Table data using the variable you have created in the first step.
3. In the updateData query, add two `Query Success` events. First event will run the getData query and second event will update the variable that you had created in the first step with the data returned by the getData query.
Let me know if this works.

Add an event to the query that you are using to update the data. Below are the steps:

 Open the Query Panel and navigate to the query that you are using to update the data.

 Select `Query Success` as the Event and `Run Query` as the Action.
 Select the query that populates the data in the Table Component as the Query under Action Options.
<https://docs.tooljet.com/docs/getting-started/quickstart-guide#5-add-new-employee>

data.subject: Resolving ToolJet Initial Setup Issues
data.summary: <@4J16f09> asked for help on initial ToolJet setup with issues related to end-user addition, email verification, and a REST API bug. <@4K10fc> and <@4Lcf1> provided clarifications and solutions, but one issue related to the REST API task remained, pending <@4J16f09>'s further reply to <@4Lc34>.

elements.text: asked for help on initial ToolJet setup with issues related to end-user addition, email verification, and a REST API bug.
provided clarifications and solutions, but one issue related to the REST API task remained, pending

chats.text:
Hi <@4J16f09> :wave:

> 1. How do I add an end user? 
End users are the users that can only view the application and dont have the permission to edit. You can invite the users to the workspace from <https://docs.tooljet.com/docs/tutorial/manage-users-groups#inviting-users|Users> settings.
>  How can I ensure that end users are required to log in when they browse the web page?
Make sure that when you release an application it is not <https://docs.tooljet.com/docs/app-builder/share|made public> , if it is set to public then anyone with the URL will be able to use the app without signing in.

> 2. When I create a new account on the /signup page, I do not receive a verification email.
As <@4K10fc> mentioned, you will need to <https://docs.tooljet.com/docs/setup/env-vars/#smtp-configuration--optional-|set-up the environment variable> for SMTP to receive the verification email.

data.subject: Parsing REST API Response to JSON Using Python

elements.text: faced an issue while parsing REST API response to JSON. Sought help, but later self-resolved it using 'create_proxy' from 'pyodide.ffi'.

chats.text:
Hi, I've 2 datasources:
 REST API (rest_api) -> Event: Query Succes -> Action: Run Query: runpy2
 Run Python Code (runpy2) 
In runpy2 I've:
```import xml.etree.ElementTree as ET

def parseXmlToJson(xml):
  response = {}

  for child in list(xml):
    if len(list(child)) > 0:
      response[child.tag] = parseXmlToJson(child)
    else:
      response[child.tag] = child.text or ''
  return response

query_from_rest_api = queries.rest_api.data

root = ET.fromstring(query_from_rest_api)
parsed = parseXmlToJson(root)

components.text4.setText(parsed)```

chats.text:
Hey <@4J16e7f> could you try these steps:
1. Add a text input component on the canvas where the user can input the questions.
2. Add a button on the canvas which would have a event handler to run the rest api query
3. Get the value of input from the inspector and pass it in the rest api body (looking at api docs is recommended).
4. Run the query and get the response of the query.
5. Display the response data from the query in text component by passing the value of text component as `{{queries.<queryname>.data}}` 
hope this helps!

data.summary: <@4J15510> was confused about different versions of ToolJet on his server. <@4Lc35> explained the differences among them and suggested to use `tooljet/tooljet-ce` for the open source version.

elements.text: was confused about different versions of ToolJet on his server.
explained the differences among them and suggested to use

chats.text:
Hi guys,

I have a doubt, i got my tooljet server installed following this page <https://docs.tooljet.com/docs/setup/ecs/>

And i have noticed this label Version 2.27.3-ee2.12.0 in my server. And i dont think so this is the open source version, right?

If im right, could you say me if there is some page to install tooljet opensource version over ECS pls ?

elements.text:
Hi guys,

I have a doubt, i got my tooljet server installed following this page

And i have noticed this label Version 2.27.3-ee2.12.0 in my server. And i dont think so this is the open source version, right?

If im right, could you say me if there is some page to install tooljet opensource version over ECS pls ?

chats.text:
Hi,

The version mentioned is the official distribution of ToolJet. The free plan has nearly all features of the open-source version. If you want to use just the community edition features, you can simply change the name of image in ECS to `tooljet/tooljet-ce:<version_tag>` .

chats.text:
`tooljet/tooljet-ce` is the community edition. It is built using our open-source codebase.

`tooljet/tooljet-server-ce`  is same as the previous image but only has the code for backend. You will have to deploy frontend somewhere else. This image is not recommended.

`tooljet/tooljet` is the distribution of ToolJet with paid features and a free plan as well. Free plan has features similar to the. If you want to upgrade to a paid plan later, you can do so by updating the license key.

Right now I have a JS run at page load with Timout function of 300 ms, followed by an action that runs the query. chats.text:
It works fine on my computer and Ipad.  As mentioned, there are some queries, unrelated to the display, that don't run until some choices are made.  On one of the apps, the flags saying they didn't run come down.  But that has never stopped this app from displaying, and they have nothing to do with the many components that don't rely on them to display.

Again, apologies, but I have to run until later.  This is something that was reported by multiple people this AM.  I will do more research and give you more info later.

data.subject: Securing and Deploying Application with ToolJet
data.summary: <@4J16e7e> asked how to secure and deploy ToolJet applications. <@4Kf63e> provided documentation links explaining the Role-Based Access Control system and the deployment process.

elements.text: asked how to secure and deploy ToolJet applications.
provided documentation links explaining the Role-Based Access Control system and the deployment process.

chats.text:
Good morning, afternoon or evening all
I've enjoyed my initial work with tooljet, which is admittedly simply creating a CRUD interface over a few backend postgres tables we have - but I'm looking to bring it into my company, however I would like to secure the application (and also deploy it effectively).
I apologize if this is clear in the docs, I couldn't work out how to provide the published url or how to secure the application to a given set of logins ...
Thanks for any assistance!

elements.text:
Good morning, afternoon or evening all
I've enjoyed my initial work with tooljet, which is admittedly simply creating a CRUD interface over a few backend postgres tables we have - but I'm looking to bring it into my company, however I would like to secure the application (and also deploy it effectively).
I apologize if this is clear in the docs, I couldn't work out how to provide the published url or how to secure the application to a given set of logins ...
Thanks for any assistance!

chats.text:
Hi Rob,

We are glad you are enjoying ToolJet.

ToolJet employs a Role-Based Access Control (RBAC) system to manage security and access to its resources, which include apps, folders, and workspace variables. Below is the documentation link that might help you understand how to secure the applications, invite users, etc.
<https://docs.tooljet.com/docs/tutorial/manage-users-groups>

Also, you can find all deployment related information under the `Setup` category in docs:
<https://docs.tooljet.com/docs/setup/digitalocean>

cc: <@4K1ea3>

chats.text:
Hi, I'm new here, trying to get my head around community edition vs cloud free edition, there're a couple thread here and there but no precise answer.

Am I correct to say that there's no difference on these 2 version apart from self-hosting removed the 5 table limit for the built in database, which if using external data connection, there is practically no difference.

Paid cloud plan features are not available in community edition at all
